contacting_master_responsible.title: Contacting Master Responsible for admission letter

<blockquote class='border-l-4 border-red-400 bg-red-50 p-4 my-4'>

Your email should be polite, enthusiastic, and clear. Here is a template you can adapt:
<blockquote class='border-l-4 border-gray-400 pl-4 italic mt-4 bg-gray-50 p-4'>

Pourriez-vous s'il vous pla√Æt m'indiquer la proc√©dure √† suivre et les documents √† fournir pour les √©tudiants issus de notre parcours afin de finaliser mon inscription et d'obtenir l'attestation n√©cessaire ?

contacting_housing.title: Contacting RI-BAI/Foyer/CROUS for logement letter
content: Securing your accommodation is a critical step, and the official housing letter ('attestation de logement') is a mandatory document for your visa application. You will need to contact the International Welcome Office (Bureau d'Accueil International - BAI) to start this process.
You can reach them at the following email address: ri-bai@univ-lemans.fr.
<blockquote class='border-l-4 border-red-400 bg-red-50 p-4 my-4'>
Important Deadline: The deadline for submitting the housing application form is typically in mid-July. Contact them early to ensure you don't miss it!
Here is an email template you can adapt to request information about the housing application process:
<blockquote class='border-l-4 border-gray-400 pl-4 italic mt-4 bg-gray-50 p-4'>
Objet : Demande d'information pour logement en r√©sidence universitaire - √âtudiant Double Dipl√¥me
Madame, Monsieur,

Je vous contacte aujourd'hui concernant ma situation. R√©cemment admis en premi√®re ann√©e de Master Informatique √† Le Mans Universit√© pour la rentr√©e de septembre 2025, suite √† ma r√©ussite au programme de double dipl√¥me avec la FSEGS de Sfax, je suis √† la recherche d'un logement.
Je suis tr√®s int√©ress√© par les options de logement sur le campus et souhaiterais conna√Ætre les d√©marches √† suivre pour faire une demande de chambre en r√©sidence universitaire (CROUS).

[Votre Nom]
What to Expect Next

content: <blockquote class='border-l-4 border-yellow-400 bg-yellow-50 p-4'>
Disclaimer: This information is accurate for the academic year 2025/2026. While it may remain valid for subsequent years, official verification is always recommended.
<hr class='my-6'>

Campus France
To get your preliminary admission agreement ('Accord pr√©alable d'inscription'), you need to complete your Campus France procedure. Here are the key requirements:

• '√âtudes en France' Account: You must create an account on the official platform: √âtudes en France. The full procedure is detailed in the main Campus France section.
• Admission Letter: You will need the M1 admission letter ('lettre d'attestation d'inscription') from the university. See the Contacting Master Responsible section.

<hr class='my-6'>
<div class='flex items-center space-x-4'>

Below is a detailed breakdown of the documents required by TLS, based on the official checklist.
<ol class='list-decimal list-inside space-y-6 mt-4'>
• Visa Application Checklist: This refers to the official PDF. Download it here and use it to track your progress.
• France-Visas Form: The application form filled out on the official France-Visas website. (A guide on how to fill this form will be added in a separate section).
• ID Photo: One recent photograph that meets the official French visa standards.
• Passport: Bring your original passport (valid for at least 1 year and 3 months) and a photocopy of all pages with personal data.
• Academic Documents:
<ul class='list-disc list-inside ml-6 mt-2 space-y-1'>

• Proof of Financial Means (Garant):

• Proof of Accommodation: The housing letter ('attestation de logement') from CROUS. See the housing section.

campus_france.title: Campus France Procedure
content: The Campus France (Maison de France) procedure is primarily to validate your admission letter with the university. Here is a detailed walkthrough of the process on their platform.
Step 1: Create Your Account
First, create an account on the Etudes en France platform: pastel.diplomatie.gouv.fr.
Once logged in, look at the top right side of the page. You will see your name and your ID (e.g., TNXX-XXXXX). Write this ID down, as you will need it later.
Step 2: Finalize Your Procedure
In the main navbar, click on 'Je suis accept√©'.
Then, open the section named '1 - Je finalise ma proc√©dure'. You will need to fill out the following subsections.
1.1 - Je choisis mes projets d'√©tudes

You need to provide 6 pieces of information here. The 6th item, 'Je joins un justificatif', is where you must upload your admission letter (attestation d'inscription) and your housing letter (attestation de logement).
1.2 - Je saisis mes informations personnelles
This section is mostly straightforward. Here are clarifications for specific fields:
<ul class='list-disc list-inside space-y-2 mt-2'>
• Under 'Statut particulier': Set 'Bourse' to 'Pas de cas particulier' and 'Autre cas' to 'Convention de partenariat'.
• Under 'Mon Cursus', you must add an entry for EVERY YEAR since your baccalaur√©at, uploading the relevant translated documents for each:
<ul class='list-circle list-inside ml-6 space-y-1 mt-1'>
• Baccalaur√©at: Diploma + Transcript (Relev√© de note).
• L1, L2: Transcript for each year.
• L3: Diploma + Transcript.
• All documents must be translated into French. A list of approved translators will be in the Important Contacts section.
• 'Mes s√©jours en France' and 'Mes tests et examens de fran√ßais' can be left empty if not applicable.
• For 'Mon niveau de fran√ßais', you can simply mention your high school (lyc√©e) experience.
1.3 - Je v√©rifie que tout est complet et je confirme mon choix
Carefully review all the information you have entered and then submit your application.
Step 3: University Validation & Payment

After submitting, you can go to Maison de France for the first time. You will receive an authentication notification on the platform or by email. Now, you must contact your Master's responsible, provide them with your Pastel ID, and ask them to email Maison de France to confirm your enrollment. Maison de France will provide you with the specific email address to use.
After this, you can go pay the fee at Maison de France. They do not accept cash; payment must be made by card (TPE).
Step 4: The Final Visit & Visa Appointment
Once your application is validated, you will be able to download your 'Accord pr√©alable' from the Pastel platform. This document is your golden ticket‚Äîtake good care of it!
For your final visit, bring the printed 'Accord pr√©alable', all the original documents you uploaded, and your passport to Maison de France. They will stamp your accord.
Finally, they will ask you to choose an appointment date for your visa procedure with TLS. Once you select a date, you are done with Campus France. Good luck with the next step!
